name: Apples, Potatoes, and Bacon
summary: This dinner is a fry-up, of sorts. The smell of apples and smoked bacon frying on a damp day brings everyone into the kitchen, plate in hand.

name: Cheesy Loaded Sweet Potatoes
summary: For a quick 15-minute dinner, you can steam the potatoes up to five days in advance. Serve with lots of fixings for an easy variation on the taco bar concept.

name: Corned Beef with Crispy Potatoes and Cabbage
summary: This update of the classic corned beef dinner nixes boring, boiled sides in favor of extra-crispy roasted cabbage and potato wedges and a vibrant, seedy dressing.

name: Sunday Stash Sweet Potatoes
summary: This simple preparation of sweet potatoes can become the base for many lunches and weeknight meals.

name: Make-Ahead Mashed Potatoes
summary: You can make and chill these mashed potatoes up to two days before the big night.

name: Dinner Salad with Radicchio and Roasted Sweet Potatoes
summary: Eggs and roasted sweet potatoes make this salad a full meal, not a sidekick. Feel free to swap in whatever protein and roasted vegetables you may have on hand.

name: Chile-and-Citrus–Rubbed Chicken with Potatoes
summary: Letting a roast chicken sit for up to 45 minutes helps prevent the juices from running out of the meat as soon as you slice into it.

name: Shingled Sweet Potatoes with Harissa
summary: Harissa lends both a spiciness and an earthiness to this savory sweet potato dish. We promise you won’t miss the marshmallows.

name: Sweet Potatoes with Spiced Lamb and Mushrooms
summary: Halved sweet potatoes steam in the time it takes to sauté mushrooms and ground lamb with a heap of fragrant spices. Crisp shaved veg and a simple yogurt sauce round it out for your new go-to weeknight dinner.

name: Papas con Rajas
summary: This combination of roasted poblano chiles, cubed boiled potatoes, onions, and crema, cooked into a savory concoction makes a divine vegetarian taco filling.

name: Buddha Bowl with Roasted Sweet Potatoes
summary: Composed of four elements—vegetables, a grain, a protein, and a sauce—Buddha bowls like this one are simple, nutrient-dense, and very pretty to serve.

name: Cornbread Stuffing with Chorizo and Sweet Potatoes
summary: This flavor-packed holiday side feeds a crowd of 20 and takes care of both the stuffing and the sweet potatoes.

name: Sheet-Pan Curry Pork Chops and Sweet Potatoes
summary: Roast halved sweet potatoes and spiced pork chops on one pan, then top with a lemony yogurt sauce, crispy radishes, and tart pomegranate seeds.

name: Spicy Smoked Gouda Twice-Baked Potatoes
summary: These are super easy to make; your fam and friends will be impressed and unable to stop praising your genius potato skills.

name: Dill Potatoes
summary: Serve these easy boiled potatoes with slow cooker corned beef, or any hearty main course.

name: Lamb Tagine with Potatoes and Peas
summary: Tagines are typical street food in Morocco, and this is the one that is most commonly found, except that street vendors cut the potatoes into small dice and I prefer to use new potatoes, which I leave whole if they are very small or halve if they are medium.

name: Crunchy Gluten-Free Chicken Tenders
summary: Rice Chex cereal crushes up into a crunchy coating for these easy chicken fingers.

name: Charred Sweet Potatoes with Toum
summary: This recipe is nice twice. The roasting and honey-glazing method is a great way to make sweet potatoes, and you also get an eggless garlic sauce that you’ll use again and again.

name: Slow Cooker Corned Beef Brisket
summary: Corned beef is timeless and deserves a spot at the table, not just on St. Paddy’s Day. It is a crowd-pleaser that loves the low-and-slow ethos of the slow cooker, turning it tender without fail.

name: Slow Cooker Miso-Butter Roast Chicken and Potatoes
summary: Slow-cooking a "roast" chicken yields moist, juicy meat but flabby skin—the easy fix is to run the carved chicken under the broiler to crisp the skin before serving.

name: Tandoori Chicken Sheet-Pan Supper
summary: No tandoor oven? No problem. This recipe for chicken and vegetables marinated in yogurt and spices is cooked on a single sheet pan in a regular home oven.

name: Lentil and Chicken Soup with Sweet Potatoes
summary: Turn store-bought rotisserie chicken (or leftover turkey, if you still have some kicking around) into a hearty soup in about half an hour. Fresh dill and lemon add a nice dose of brightness.

name: Parsnip Skordalia
summary: This riff on the Greek classic swaps out potatoes for parsnips, which gives the dip a touch of sweetness that pairs well with the feta and chiles.

name: Maple Meatloaf Muffins
summary: Sweet potatoes and maple syrup add natural sweetness to these muffins—perfect for prepping for a week of breakfasts, dinners, or lunches.

name: Black Lentil and Harissa-Roasted Veggie Bowl
summary: We love the roasted sweet potatoes in this bowl, but any hardy vegetable would be just as delicious. Try delicata squash, cauliflower, or eggplant.

name: New Year's Eve Meat Pie
summary: Store-bought puff pastry and a meat-and-potatoes filling come together as your New Year’s Eve dinner centerpiece.

name: Chicken Stew with Potatoes and Radishes
summary: This one-pot comfort-food stew takes its flavor cues from chicken paprikash. Cooking low and slow is the key to getting deep flavor and the perfect texture; make sure to simmer the stew until the potatoes are creamy and the chicken is pull-apart tender.

name: Crispy Skin Chicken with Dill and Garlic Sauce
summary: Served with garlicky boiled potatoes and topped with crunchy fried shallots and lots of fresh dill, this dish is perfect to welcome spring.

name: Burnished Potato Nuggets
summary: Any cooking oil or rendered fat will work for making these supremely crunchy potatoes. Bonus: The fluffy insides are perfect for sopping up gravy.

name: Steak and Crispy Smashed Potatoes for Two
summary: Looking for a special dinner for two? First, pan-sear one big steak to share. Then, while the steak rests, use the fat rendered behind in the skillet to sear smashed paprika-spiced potatoes to crispy, golden perfection.

name: Herby Garlic Confit
summary: You can spread the cloves on grilled bread, marinate olives and feta with the garlicky oil, mash cloves into store-bought mayo, or stir into mashed potatoes.

name: Crispy Baby Yukon Gold Potatoes
summary: You can’t go wrong with roasted potatoes for a holiday meal. A mix of fresh thyme and nutmeg keeps this version interesting.

name: Sausage and Greens Sheet-Pan Dinner
summary: With crispy mini potatoes and hearty greens that are roasted in a sweet-tart mustard dressing, this 25-minute dinner is an easy crowd-pleaser.

name: Salsa Rustica with Egg and Pancetta
summary: Spoon salsa rustica over grilled bread, grilled or roasted vegetables, roasted potatoes, sautéed greens, sliced tomatoes, boiled green beans, or cauliflower.

name: Roasted Niçoise Salad with Halibut
summary: Jarred marinated artichoke hearts get super-crispy and addictively delicious when roasted, making them the secret star of this simple sheet-pan dinner.

name: Ultra-Creamy Mashed Potatoes
summary: Unpeeled potatoes absorb less moisture when boiled, and the ricer will catch the skins—great news for lazy cooks everywhere.

name: Instant Pot Beef and Sweet Potato Chili
summary: Sweet potatoes almost melt as they cook under pressure in the Instant Pot, lending a silky texture and sweet flavor to this harissa-spiced chili.

name: Potato Tart with Mustard Greens and Thyme
summary: Whole wheat phyllo dough makes a crispy crust for this lively potato tart with the flavors of mustard greens, lemon thyme, and goat cheese.

name: Perfectly Roasted Potatoes
summary: You know what goes with pretty much everything? Crispy, creamy, perfectly roasted potatoes. The secret: Steam before you roast.

name: Farro Salad with Roasted Sweet Potatoes, Red Onion, and Goat Cheese
summary: I love me a farro salad! The hearty grain is an amazing base for all sorts of veggie combinations and it’s super convenient to work with since you can cook it several days ahead. I tend to follow a loose formula: farro plus roasted veggies, a bright herb, a crunchy nut or seed, some creamy cheese, and a zingy dressing. Here, sweet potatoes and red onions caramelize gorgeously in the oven, while the earthy goat cheese and zippy vinaigrette balance out the sweetness. Feel free to play—roasted beets or winter squash would be lovely, as would hazelnuts, almonds, or feta.

name: Roasted Winter Squash with Kale Pipian
summary: If you can find it, try making this green sauce with hoja santa, a robust aromatic Mexican herb—if not, any hardy green will work (we call for kale).

name: Roasted Sweet Potatoes with Chile Yogurt and Mint
summary: This twice-roasted method allows for the sweet potatoes to get super-creamy on the inside while their skins get a little crispy.

name: Grilled Clambake with Miso-Lime Butter
summary: Clams, potatoes, shrimp, and corn on the cob get an extra layer of flavor when grilled and brushed with gingery miso butter in this festive, large-format feast.

name: Chicken Fricassée with Lemon Mustard Sauce
summary: There may be more sauce than you need to serve with the chicken. Use the leftovers on mashed potatoes or simply freeze for another time.

name: Sweet Potato Toasts with Toppings
summary: Serve this easy-to-make “toast” just as you would traditional toast and top it with your favorite toppings, such as avocado, a poached or fried egg, microgreens, tahini, fresh berries, hemp seeds, a nut butter, bananas, or strawberries.

name: Here Comes the Sun Breakfast Bowl
summary: Pile roasted sweet potatoes, sautéed kale, black beans, and a sunny-side egg over grains for a healthful, filling grain bowl that'll power you through the day.

name: Cucumbers with Ajo Blanco Sauce
summary: Think of this as an all-purpose garlic sauce. Once you get the hang of making it, try swapping cashews or blanched hazelnuts for the almonds.

name: Low-Fuss Crispy Roast Chicken
summary: Rendering fat trickles from the chicken as it roasts onto a bed of sliced potatoes and onions, resulting in a deliciously crisp and juicy low-fuss bird with a built-in side dish.

name: Stuffed Sweet Potatoes with Curried Chickpeas
summary: Embrace the start of autumn with cozy, Indian-inspired sweet potatoes loaded with curry-spiced chickpeas, mushrooms, and spinach.

name: No-Frills Shrimp Boil
summary: Set a large colander in the sink before you add the shrimp so you can drain the boil as soon as it comes off the heat.

name: BBQ Pork Chops with Herb-Butter Corn and Sweet Potatoes
summary: You don't have to fire up the grill to enjoy a taste of barbecue. This pork chop dinner makes use of the broiler to get those smoky, charred flavors on the table anytime you want them.

name: Sweet Potato Sonker with Milk Dip
summary: This North Carolinian cobbler-like dessert, with both a bottom crust and lattice top, is topped with a sweetened milk “dip” after baking for a time and then returned to the oven so that the dip forms a rich glaze.

name: Instant Pot Caldo Verde
summary: The ingredients of this classic Portuguese soup (namely chorizo, kale, and potatoes) meld beautifully under pressure, so you only need water—no stock—to get a savory, rich broth.

name: Charred Sweet Potatoes with Honey and Olive Oil
summary: Japanese sweet potatoes are starchier than yams and worth seeking out. Steaming before grilling keeps them moist.

name: Crushed Potatoes with Oyster Bar Butter
summary: Make extra seasoned butter to eat with pasta, on crusty bread, or, as the name implies, with shellfish.

name: Pickled Mustard Seeds
summary: Mustard seeds that have been plumped in a pickle brine can really make a dish. They provide texture and crunch, heat and sweetness.

name: Grilled Lemon-Garlic Chicken and Potatoes
summary: Everything for this simple, Spanish-inspired dish gets tossed in the same lemon, garlic, and smoked paprika marinade, then cooked in a grill basket for an easier, faster way to grill dinner.

name: Sweet Potato–Tahini Dip with Za'atar
summary: Since the base of this dip is so simple—it's mostly sweet potatoes and tahini—homemade za'atar (a Middle Eastern spice blend) really helps the flavors stand out.

name: Gujarti Eggplant and Sweet Potato "Lasagna" with Kadi Sauce
summary: This playful Indian take on veggie lasagna pairs chickpea-flour noodles with eggplant, sweet potatoes, and chile- and ginger-spiced tomato and yogurt sauces.

name: Roasted Sweet Potato and Ginger Soup
summary: There are some flavors that beg to be paired, and sweet potatoes and ginger are in that category. This smooth, puréed soup is rich and comforting, ideal for fall evenings.

name: Roasted Sweet Potato and Delicata Squash with Cranberry Agrodolce
summary: The sweet and sour cranberry sauce for this holiday-ready side does double duty: it looks gorgeous (and tastes great) drizzled over roasted delicata squash and sweet potatoes, but it’s also an excellent turkey condiment. Don’t worry—this recipe makes a good amount so you'll have plenty to serve on the side.

name: Cheesy Potato and Kale Gratin with Rye Croutons
summary: There’s no need to reduce your cream or pre-cook the kale for this aromatic casserole; everything cooks together in cheesy, creamy harmony. Leaving the potatoes unpeeled bumps up nutrients and cuts the prep time, too.
